member.summary: Clones an object instead of letting it clone itsself or using a Reflection-driven approach.

member.summary: Checks whether this surrogate is able to clone the specified object type.

member.returns: True, if this surrogate is able to clone such object, false if not.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneSurrogate.SetupCloneTargets(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean@,Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup)
member.summary:
Performs the cloning setup step, in which all reference-type instances from the target object graph are generated.
The purpose of this method is to help the cloning system walk the entire (relevant) object graph in order to determine which objects are referenced and which are owned / deep-cloned, as well as creating instances or re-using existing instances from the target graph.
Walking the specified object's part of the source object graph and mapping instances to their target object graph correspondents is done by using the interface methods for handling object instances and struct values.
member.param: The object instance from the source graph that is being investigated right now.

The object instance from the target graph that corresponds to the object's instance in the source graph. When invoking this method, the target object will either have existed already, or been created by the cloning system.
Specified whether this kind of object requires a late setup step, allowing to create its instance only the entire other target object graph has already been created.
The setup environment for the cloning operation.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneSurrogate.LateSetup(System.Object,System.Object@,Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation)
member.summary:
Performs a late setup for the source object. This is similar to the step, except that all other objects from the target graph have already been created and a full source-target mapping is available.
A late-setup step is usually not required and should be avoided as long as it's not a necessity.
member.param: The object instance from the source graph that is being set up right now.

The object instance from the target graph that corresponds to the object's instance in the source graph. In the late-setup step, there already is a preliminary target object instance, but it can be replaced by re-assigning the target reference.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneSurrogate.CopyDataTo(System.Object,System.Object,Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation)
member.summary: Performs the cloning copy step, in which all data is copied from source instances to target instances. No new object instances should be created in this step, as object creation should be part of the setup step instead.
member.param: The object instance from the source graph that is being copied.

The object instance from the target graph that corresponds to this object's instance in the source graph. When invoking this method, the target object will either have existed already, or been created by the cloning system.

member.name: P:Duality.Cloning.ICloneSurrogate.Priority
member.summary: [GET] If more than one registered ISurrogate is capable of cloning a given object type, the one with the highest priority is picked.

member.summary: [GET] Specifies whether the surrogates client object requires a manual merge between source and target objects, e.g. whether its manual object handling methods will be called even when the source object is null.

member.summary: Checks whether this surrogate is able to clone the specified object type.

member.summary: Adds an already loaded plugin Assembly to the internal Duality T registry. You shouldn't need to call this method in general, since Duality manages its plugins automatically.
member.remarks: This method can be useful in certain cases when it is necessary to treat an Assembly as a Duality plugin, even though it isn't located in the Plugins folder, or is not available as a file at all. A typical case for this is Unit Testing where the testing Assembly may specify additional Duality types such as Components, Resources, etc.

member.name: T:Duality.CorePluginManager
member.summary:
Manages loading, reloading, initialization and disposal of Duality core plugins.
Since all assemblies are owned by the .Net runtime that only exposes a very limited degree of control, this class should only be used statically: Disposing it would only get rid of management data, not of the actual plugin assemblies, which would then cause problems.
A static instance of this class is available through .

member.name: M:Duality.CorePluginManager.#ctor
member.summary: should usually not be instantiated by users due to its forced singleton-like usage. Use instead.

member.summary: The object will be handled automatically according to its Type properties and Attributes.

member.summary: The object will be assigned by-reference, because external ownership is assumed.

member.summary: The object will be cloned deeply, because local ownership is assumed.

member.name: F:Duality.Cloning.CloneBehavior.WeakReference
member.summary: If the referenced object is part of the cloned object graph, it will be assigned by-reference similar to the setting. Otherwise, it will be skipped without assigning any value. A typical example are "parent"-backreferences from child objects.

member.name: T:Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation
member.summary: Cloning system interface that allows an or to take part in the copy step of a cloning operation. The purpose of the copy step is to synchronously walk source and target object graphs while copying all data from source to target.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation.GetTarget``1(``0,``0@)
member.summary: Retrieves the target object that is mapped to the specified source object.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation.IsTarget``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified object is part of the target object graph.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation.HandleObject``1(``0,``0@)
member.summary: Walks the object graph of the specified instance from the source graph, while copying its data to the graph that is spanned by its target object. May re-assign the target object in the process.
member.param: An object from the source graph that will be copied by the cloning system.
The object's equivalent from the target graph to which data will be copied.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation.HandleValue``1(``0@,``0@)
member.summary: Walks the object graph of the specified data structure from the source graph, while copying its data to the graph that is spanned by its target struct. May re-assign the target struct in the process.
member.param: A struct from the source graph that will be copied by the cloning system.
The struct's equivalent from the target graph to which data will be copied.

member.name: P:Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation.Context
member.summary: [GET] The context of this cloning operation, which can provide additional settings.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ExtMethodsICloneOperation.HandleObject``1(Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation,``0,``0)
member.summary: Special version of for cases where the target object is stored in a data structure that does not allow by-ref access or re-assignment of the target object. When possible, prefer the by-ref base version.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ExtMethodsICloneOperation.HandleObject``1(Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation,``0,``0@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Special version of for cases where the target object graph alreay exists and it is undesireable for a source value of null to overwrite a non-null target value.

member.name: F:Duality.Cloning.CloneFieldFlags.None
member.summary: No flags are set at all.

member.name: F:Duality.Cloning.CloneFieldFlags.IdentityRelevant
member.summary: States that the Field or Object in question is relevant to its parents identity and thus should not be cloned in an identity-preserving context.

member.name: F:Duality.Cloning.CloneFieldFlags.Skip
member.summary: The Field or Object in question will always be skipped during cloning. No value will be assigned at all.

member.name: F:Duality.Cloning.CloneFieldFlags.DontSkip
member.summary: The Field or Object in question won't be skipped during cloning due to secondary hints such as a attribute on the same field.

member.name: T:Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup
member.summary: Cloning system interface that allows an or to take part in the setup step of a cloning operation. The purpose of the setup step is to walk the source object graph and create the required instances of the target graph where they do not exist yet.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup.AddTarget``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Specifies an existing mapping between source and target object graph, in which references to a source object are re-mapped to the specified target object. Does not investigate the specified source object for further references or walks its object graph.
member.param: A reference from the source graph that will be re-mapped in the target graph.
The target graph object that this reference will be re-mapped to.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup.HandleObject``1(``0,``0,Duality.Cloning.CloneBehavior,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary: Walks the object graph of the specified instance from the source graph, while mapping it to the graph that is spanned by the specified target object. When specified, the default of the source object or a certain type of its child objects can be overridden locally.
member.param: An object from the source graph that will be investigated by the cloning system.
The object's already existing equivalent from the target graph to which it will be mapped.
An optional override for the cloning behavior of this object.
When specified, the optional override will only be active for the first level of referenced objects of this type.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup.HandleValue``1(``0@,``0@,Duality.Cloning.CloneBehavior,System.Reflection.TypeInfo)
member.summary:
Walks the object graph of the specified data struct from the source graph, while mapping it to the graph that is spanned by the specified target struct. When specified, the default of the source object or a certain type of its child objects can be overridden locally.
Note that this only makes sense if the struct contains object references and is not just plain-old data.
member.param: A struct from the source graph that will be investigated by the cloning system.
The struct's already existing equivalent from the target graph to which it will be mapped.
An optional override for the cloning behavior of this struct.
When specified, the optional override will only be active for the first level of referenced objects of this type.

member.name: P:Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup.Context
member.summary: [GET] The context of this cloning operation, which can provide additional settings.

member.name: T:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode
member.summary: Enumerates different behviours on how to blend color data onto existing background color.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Reset
member.summary: When passing this to a method, this value can be used to indicate "Restore to default settings".

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Solid
member.summary: Incoming color overwrites background color completely. Doesn't need Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Mask
member.summary: Incoming color overwrites background color but leaves out areas with low alpha. Doesn't need Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Add
member.summary: Incoming color is multiplied by its alpha value and then added to background color. Needs Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Alpha
member.summary: Incoming color overwrites background color, weighted by its alpha value. Needs Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.AlphaPre
member.summary: Premultiplied Alpha: Colors specify brightness, alpha specifies opacity. Needs Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Incoming color scales background color. Needs Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Light
member.summary: Incoming color is multiplied and then added to background color. Needs Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Invert
member.summary: Incoming color inverts background color. Needs Z-Sorting.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.BlendMode.Count
member.summary: The total number of available BlendModes.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.AssetInfo
member.summary:
Provides information on the way a should be treated during Asset import operations in the editor.
This information should not be considered to be available at runtime or after deploying a game without editor support.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.AssetInfo.ImporterId
member.summary: [GET / SET] The ID of the Asset Importer that was used to import this Asset. If set, it will be automatically used for Re-Import operations.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.AssetInfo.SourceFileHint
member.summary: [GET / SET] When set, this array provides a hint to the AssetManagement system which source files were used to create this during the most recent import operation. The paths are relative to the mapped media source directory of the and can use the {Name} variable to keep paths invariant to move and rename operations.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.AssetInfo.CustomData
member.summary: [GET / SET] A collection of key-value pairs that can be used to attach custom asset data to the asset info of a . This data can be used by importers and exporters to persistently store parameters and user configuration regarding import and export opreations of this .

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.AssetInfo.NameHint
member.summary: [GET / SET] For runtime-only Resources that haven't been saved or located anywhere, this property provides a hint on how to name the Resource later. This property is considered temporary and won't be serialized.

member.name: T:Duality.Drawing.TextureSizeMode
member.summary: Defines how a Texture should handle pixel data without power-of-two dimensions.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureSizeMode.Enlarge
member.summary: Enlarges the images dimensions without scaling the image, leaving the new space empty. Texture coordinates are automatically adjusted in order to display the image correctly. This preserves the images full quality but prevents tiling, if not power-of-two anyway.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureSizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretches the image to fit power-of-two dimensions and downscales it again when displaying. This might blur the image slightly but allows tiling it.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureSizeMode.NonPowerOfTwo
member.summary: The images dimensions are not affected, as OpenGL uses an actual non-power-of-two texture. However, this might be unsupported on older hardware.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureSizeMode.Default
member.summary: The default behaviour. Equals .

member.name: T:Duality.Drawing.TextureMagFilter
member.summary: Defines which filtering algorithm will be used when displaying the Texture larger than it is.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMagFilter.Nearest
member.summary: Point filtering with sharp edges.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMagFilter.Linear
member.summary: Linear interpolation.

member.name: T:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter
member.summary: Defines which filtering algorithm will be used when displaying the Texture smaller than it is.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter.Nearest
member.summary: Point filtering with sharp edges.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter.Linear
member.summary: Linear interpolation.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter.NearestMipmapNearest
member.summary: Point filtering with sharp edges. Mipmaps will be used, but switch from one to the next instantly.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter.LinearMipmapNearest
member.summary: Linear interpolation. Mipmaps will be used, but switch from one to the next instantly.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter.NearestMipmapLinear
member.summary: Point filtering with sharp edges. Mipmaps will be used and smoothly blend over from one to the next.

member.name: F:Duality.Drawing.TextureMinFilter.LinearMipmapLinear
member.summary: Linear interpolation. Mipmaps will be used and smoothly blend over from one to the next.

member.name: T:Duality.Input.Key
member.summary:
Each enum entry represents a physical key location on a keyboard. These are not virtual key codes, but instead correspond to scancodes and thus should be thought of as position indicators of a pressed key, rather than a description of the letter that is printed on it.
In naming the enum entries, a US / Ascii / QWERTY keyboard is assumed as a reference.

member.summary: The resize will scale the object so it fits inside the target rect, while keeping its aspect ratio.

member.name: T:Duality.RefreshMode
member.summary: Specifies intervals and modes to refresh the screen and update the game.

member.name: F:Duality.RefreshMode.NoSync
member.summary: Refreshes occur as fast as possible with no wait inbetween.

member.name: F:Duality.RefreshMode.ManualSync
member.summary: Refreshes target 60 FPS and will use wait for each frame to use its entire available time. Doesn't use hardware / driver VSync, but prevents 100% CPU usage.

member.name: F:Duality.RefreshMode.VSync
member.summary: Refreshes wait for the hardware / driver VSync.

member.name: F:Duality.RefreshMode.AdaptiveVSync
member.summary: Refreshes wait for the hardware / driver VSync as long as the target framerate is reached. When falling below, VSync will be temporarily suspended.

member.name: T:Duality.AAQuality
member.summary: Specifies the quality level of the anti-aliasing used for rendering.

member.name: F:Duality.AAQuality.High
member.summary: Highest possible quality. Sacrifices performance for smooth edges. Can be a problem on older machines.

member.name: F:Duality.AAQuality.Medium
member.summary: Medium quality. A tradeoff between looks and Profile.

member.name: F:Duality.AAQuality.Low
member.summary: Low quality. Favors Profile.

member.name: F:Duality.AAQuality.Off
member.summary: No hardware anti-aliasing is used at all.

member.name: F:Duality.ScreenMode.Window
member.summary: Duality runs in windowed mode. The window can be resized by the user.

member.name: F:Duality.ScreenMode.FixedWindow
member.summary: Duality runs in windowed mode. The window has a fixed size.

member.name: F:Duality.ScreenMode.FullWindow
member.summary: Duality runs in windowed mode. The window is borderless and covers the whole screen.

member.name: F:Duality.ScreenMode.Native
member.summary: Duality runs in fullscreen mode, using whatever screen resolution is currently active on the users desktop.

member.name: F:Duality.ScreenMode.Fullscreen
member.summary: Duality runs in fullscreen mode and changes desktop resolution whenever necesary.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.CloneObject``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clones the specified object and returns the cloned instance.
member.param:
If true, the mapping between source and target object graph is preserved.
This can be useful for doing a partial clone operation that is later continued or repeated using the same instance. Since the mapping is already present, performance of subsequent clone operations within the same object graph can benefit by this.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.CopyObject``1(``0,``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the specified source object graph to the specified target object graph. Where possible, existing objects will be preserved and updated, rather than being overwritten.
member.param:
If true, the mapping between source and target object graph is preserved.
This can be useful for doing a partial clone operation that is later continued or repeated using the same instance. Since the mapping is already present, performance of subsequent clone operations within the same object graph can benefit by this.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.ClearCachedMapping
member.summary: Clears the clone providers internal mapping between source and target object graph. This is done automatically, unless the copy or clone operation has been performed with explicitly preserving the cache.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.BeginCloneOperation(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Prepares the clone operation by generating a mapping between source and target object graph, and creating the target objects where required in the process.
member.returns: Returns a reference to the target root object.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.EndCloneOperation(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ends the current clone operation by clearing all the working data that was allocated in the process.
member.param:
If true, the mapping between source and target object graph is preserved.
This can be useful for doing a partial clone operation that is later continued or repeated using the same instance. Since the mapping is already present, performance of subsequent clone operations within the same object graph can benefit by this.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.SetTargetOf(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a mapping from the specified source object to its target object graph equivalent. This is a one-to-one relation.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.GetTargetOf(System.Object,System.Object@)
member.summary:
Retrieves the target graph equivalent of the specified source graph object and returns whether there is a valid source-target relation.
Note that the resulting target object will (expected to) be the same as the source object in cases where there is no mapping, but reference assignment instead.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.PushCurrentObject(System.Object,Duality.Cloning.CloneType)
member.summary: Adds the specified source object to the handled object stack when required and returns whether the object need to be investigated as part of the copy step at all.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.PopCurrentObject(System.Object,Duality.Cloning.CloneType)
member.summary: Removes the specified source object from the handled object stack after finishing its copy step.

member.summary: Returns the of a Type.

member.summary: [GET] Provides information about the context in which the operation is performed.

member.name: T:Duality.Cloning.CloneProvider.ReferenceEqualityComparer
member.summary: Compares two objects for equality strictly by reference. This is needed to build the object id mapping, since some objects may expose some unfortunate equality behavior, and we really want to distinguish different objects by reference, and not by "content" here.

member.name: T:Duality.Cloning.CloneProviderContext
member.summary: Describes the context of a cloning operation

member.name: F:Duality.Cloning.CloneProviderContext.Default
member.summary: A standard cloning operation.

member.name: P:Duality.Cloning.CloneProviderContext.PreserveIdentity
member.summary: [GET] Should the operation preserve each objects identity? If false, specific identity-preserving data field such as Guid or Id fields will be copied as well. This might result in duplicate IDs.

member.name: T:Duality.Cloning.ICloneExplicit
member.summary: Provides a general interface for an object type that will provide and explicit method for cloning rather than falling back to automated cloning behavior.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneExplicit.SetupCloneTargets(System.Object,Duality.Cloning.ICloneTargetSetup)
member.summary:
Performs the cloning setup step, in which all reference-type instances from the target object graph are generated.
The purpose of this method is to help the cloning system walk the entire (relevant) object graph in order to determine which objects are referenced and which are owned / deep-cloned, as well as creating instances or re-using existing instances from the target graph.
Walking this object's part of the source object graph and mapping instances to their target object graph correspondents is done by using the interface methods for handling object instances and struct values.
member.param: The object instance from the target graph that corresponds to this object's instance in the source graph. When invoking this method, the target object will either have existed already, or been created by the cloning system.
The setup environment for the cloning operation.

member.name: M:Duality.Cloning.ICloneExplicit.CopyDataTo(System.Object,Duality.Cloning.ICloneOperation)
member.summary: Performs the cloning copy step, in which all data is copied from source instances to target instances. No new object instances should be created in this step, as object creation should be part of the setup step instead.
member.param: The object instance from the target graph that corresponds to this object's instance in the source graph. When invoking this method, the target object will either have existed already, or been created by the cloning system.

member.name: T:Duality.Component
member.summary: Components are isolated logic units that can independently be added to and removed from GameObjects. Each Component has a distinct purpose, thus it is not possible to add multiple Components of the same Type to one GameObject. Also, a Component may not belong to multiple GameObjects at once.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.GearJointInfo
member.summary:
Connects two bodies using a gear. The gear type is determined by the joints that are attached to each body. Supported joint types are Prismatic- and RevoluteJoints. Those joints are required to be either fixed or attached to a static body.
This joint type has been flagged obsolete for its unstable behavior. Consider using custom specialized physics logic instead.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.JointInfo
member.summary: Describes a joint. Joints limit a Colliders degree of freedom by connecting it to fixed world coordinates or other Colliders.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.JointInfo.CollideConnected
member.summary: [GET / SET] Specifies whether the connected Colliders will collide with each other.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.JointInfo.Enabled
member.summary: [GET / SET] Whether or not the joint is active.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.JointInfo.BreakPoint
member.summary: [GET / SET] Maximum joint error value before the joint break. Breaking does not remove the joint, but disable it. A value of zero or lower is interpreted as unbreakable. Note that some joints might not have breaking point support and will ignore this value.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.GearJointInfo.Ratio
member.summary: [GET / SET] The gear ratio by which body movement is connected.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.PulleyJointInfo
member.summary: Constrains two RigidBodies as though connected using a rope that is fixed at two world anchor points.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The first bodies local anchor point.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The second bodies local anchor point.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The first bodies world anchor point.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.PulleyJointInfo.MaxLengthB
member.summary: [GET / SET] The maximum "rope length" on the second bodies side of the pulley.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.PulleyJointInfo.TotalLength
member.summary: [GET / SET] The total length of the rope.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.LineJointInfo
member.summary: The line joint is also called "wheel joint", because it behaves like the spring of a car tire: A body is only allowed to travel on a specific world axis relative to the other one but can rotate freely or accelerated by a motor.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The car RigidBodies local anchor point.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The wheel RigidBodies local anchor point.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The axis on which the body may move.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.LineJointInfo.DampingRatio
member.summary: [GET / SET] The damping ratio. Zero means "no damping", one means "critical damping".

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.LineJointInfo.Frequency
member.summary: [GET / SET] The mass spring damper frequency in hertz.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.LineJointInfo.MotorEnabled

member.summary: [GET / SET] The maximum motor torque.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The desired motor speed in radians per frame.

member.summary: [GET] The current joint translation.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.LineJointInfo.MotorTorque
member.summary: [GET] The current joint motor torque.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.SliderJointInfo
member.summary:
Constrains two RigidBodies to keep their distance to each other in a certain range. You can view this as a massless, rigid rod.
This joint type has been flagged obsolete for its unstable behavior. Consider using prismatic, distance or line joints instead.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.SliderJointInfo.LocalAnchorA
member.summary: [GET / SET] The first bodies local anchor point.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.SliderJointInfo.LocalAnchorB
member.summary: [GET / SET] The second bodies local anchor point.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.SliderJointInfo.MaxLength
member.summary: [GET / SET] The maximum distance between both RigidBodies.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.SliderJointInfo.MinLength
member.summary: [GET / SET] The minimum distance between both RigidBodies.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody
member.summary: Represents a body instance for physical simulation, collision detection and response.

member.summary: Adds a new shape to the body.

member.summary: Removes an existing shape from the body.

member.summary: Removes all existing shapes from the body.

member.summary: Removes an existing joint from the body.

member.summary: Adds a new joint to the body.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ClearJoints
member.summary: Removes all existing joints from the body.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyLocalImpulse(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a Transform-local angular impulse to the object. You don't usually need to apply here because it is inteded to be a one-time force impact.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyLocalImpulse(Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a Transform-local impulse to the objects mass center. You don't usually need to apply here because it is inteded to be a one-time force impact.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyLocalImpulse(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a Transform-local impulse to the specified point. You don't usually need to apply here because it is inteded to be a one-time force impact.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyWorldImpulse(Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a world impulse to the objects mass center. You don't usually need to apply here because it is inteded to be a one-time force impact.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyWorldImpulse(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a world impulse to the specified world point. You don't usually need to apply here because it is inteded to be a one-time force impact.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyLocalForce(System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a Transform-local angular force to the object. You don't need to apply here, the physics simulation takes care of this.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyLocalForce(Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a Transform-local force to the objects mass center. You don't need to apply here, the physics simulation takes care of this.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyLocalForce(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a Transform-local force to the specified local point. You don't need to apply here, the physics simulation takes care of this.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyWorldForce(Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a world force to the objects mass center. You don't need to apply here, the physics simulation takes care of this.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ApplyWorldForce(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Applies a world force to the specified world point. You don't need to apply here, the physics simulation takes care of this.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.AwakeBody
member.summary: Awakes the body if it has been in a resting state that is now being left, such as when changing physical properties at runtime. You usually don't need to call this.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.PickShape(Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Performs a physical picking operation and returns the shape in which the specified world coordinate is located in.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.PickShapes(Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Performs a physical picking operation and returns the shapes that intersect the specified world coordinate.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.PickShapes(Duality.Vector2,System.Collections.Generic.List{Duality.Components.Physics.ShapeInfo})
member.summary: Performs a physical picking operation and returns the shapes that intersect the specified world coordinate.
member.param: A list that will be filled with all shapes that were found. The list will not be cleared before adding items.
member.returns: Returns whether any new shape was found.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.PickShapes(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2)
member.summary: Performs a physical picking operation and returns the shapes that intersect the specified world coordinate area.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.PickShapes(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2,System.Collections.Generic.List{Duality.Components.Physics.ShapeInfo})
member.summary: Performs a physical picking operation and returns the shapes that intersect the specified world coordinate area.
member.param: A list that will be filled with all shapes that were found. The list will not be cleared before adding items.
member.returns: Returns whether any new shape was found.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.SynchronizeBodyShape
member.summary: Forces previously scheduled body shape updates to execute. Changes to a RigidBodies shape are normally cached and executed in the following frame. Calling this method guarantes all scheduled updates to be performed immediately.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.BeginUpdateBodyShape
member.summary: Prepares this RigidBody for a large-scale shape update. This isn't required but might boost update performance.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.EndUpdateBodyShape
member.summary: Restores this RigidBody after a large-scale shape update. See .

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.RayCast(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2,Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastCallback)
member.summary: Performs a 2d physical raycast in world coordinates.
member.param: The starting point in world coordinates.
The desired end point in world coordinates.

The callback that is invoked for each hit on the raycast. Note that the order in which each hit occurs isn't deterministic and may appear random. Return -1 to ignore the curret shape, 0 to terminate the raycast, data.Fraction to clip the ray for current hit, or 1 to continue.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.RayCast(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2,Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastCallback,Duality.RawList{Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastData}@)
member.summary: Performs a 2d physical raycast in world coordinates.
member.param: The starting point in world coordinates.
The desired end point in world coordinates.

The callback that is invoked for each hit on the raycast. Note that the order in which each hit occurs isn't deterministic and may appear random. Return -1 to ignore the curret shape, 0 to terminate the raycast, data.Fraction to clip the ray for current hit, or 1 to continue.
Returns a list of all occurred hits, ordered by their Fraction value.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.RayCast(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2,Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastCallback,Duality.RawList{Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastData})
member.summary: Performs a 2d physical raycast in world coordinates.
member.param: The starting point in world coordinates.
The desired end point in world coordinates.

The callback that is invoked for each hit on the raycast. Note that the order in which each hit occurs isn't deterministic and may appear random. Return -1 to ignore the curret shape, 0 to terminate the raycast, data.Fraction to clip the ray for current hit, or 1 to continue.
A list that will be filled with all hits that were registered, ordered by their Fraction value. The list will not be cleared before adding items.
member.returns: Returns whether any new hit was registered.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.RayCast(Duality.Vector2,Duality.Vector2,Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastCallback,Duality.Components.Physics.RayCastData@)
member.summary: Performs a 2d physical raycast in world coordinates.
member.param: The starting point in world coordinates.
The desired end point in world coordinates.

The callback that is invoked for each hit on the raycast. Note that the order in which each hit occurs isn't deterministic and may appear random. Return -1 to ignore the curret shape, 0 to terminate the raycast, data.Fraction to clip the ray for current hit, or 1 to continue.
Returns the first hit that occurs, i.e. the one with the highest proximity to the starting point.
member.returns: Returns whether anything has been hit.

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.AwakeAll
member.summary: Awakes all currently existing RigidBodies.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.BodyType
member.summary: [GET / SET] The type of the physical body.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.LinearDamping
member.summary: [GET / SET] The damping that is applied to the bodies velocity.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.AngularDamping
member.summary: [GET / SET] The damping that is applied to the bodies angular velocity.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.FixedAngle
member.summary: [GET / SET] Whether the bodies rotation is fixed.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.IgnoreGravity
member.summary: [GET / SET] Whether the body ignores gravity.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.AllowParent
member.summary:
[GET / SET] By default, objects will ignore parent-child relations, which is achieved by forcing to true at runtime. When enabling , this constraint is removed.
Note that you should only use this option if you can rule out that physics simulation and parent transform changes occur within the same time frame, as they will otherwise interfere with each other and cause undefined behavior.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.ContinousCollision
member.summary: [GET / SET] Whether the body is included in continous collision detection or not. It prevents the body from moving through others at high speeds at the cost of performance.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: [GET / SET] The Colliders current linear velocity.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: [GET / SET] The Colliders current angular velocity.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Friction
member.summary: [GET / SET] The bodies overall friction value. Usually a value between 0.0 and 1.0, but higher values can be used to indicate unusually strong friction.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Restitution
member.summary: [GET / SET] The bodies overall restitution value. Should be a value between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: [GET / SET] The bodies overall mass. This is usually calculated automatically. You may however assign an explicit, fixed value to override the automatically calculated mass. To reset to automated calculation, set to zero.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Inertia
member.summary: [GET / SET] The bodies rotational inertia about the local origin. This is usually calculated automatically. You may however assign an explicit, fixed value to override the automatically calculated inertia. To reset to automated calculation, set to zero.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.CollisionCategory
member.summary: [GET / SET] A bitmask that specifies the collision categories to which this Collider belongs.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.CollidesWith
member.summary: [GET / SET] A bitmask that specifies which collision categories this Collider interacts with.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.CollisionFilter
member.summary: [GET / SET] A callbcak method that is used to determine whether or not a collision should occur. While more costly than other means of collision filtering, this allows for a more fine-grained case-to-case decision.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Revolutions
member.summary: [GET] The bodies total number of revolutions.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.WorldMassCenter
member.summary: [GET] The bodies center of mass in world coordinates.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.LocalMassCenter
member.summary: [GET] The bodies center of mass in local coordinates.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Shapes
member.summary: [GET] Enumerates all primitive shapes which this body consists of.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.Joints
member.summary: [GET] Enumerates all joints that are connected to this Collider.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.BoundRadius
member.summary: [GET] The physical bodys bounding radius.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.RigidBody.IsAwake
member.summary: [GET] Whether the body is currently awake i.e. actively simulated.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Physics.WeldJointInfo
member.summary: "Welds" two Colliders together so they share a common point and relative angle.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Physics.WeldJointInfo.LocalAnchorA
member.summary: [GET / SET] The welding point, locally to the first object.

member.name: T:Duality.ContentRef`1
member.summary: This lightweight struct references Resources in an abstract way. It is tightly connected to the and takes care of keeping or making the referenced content available when needed. Never store actual Resource references permanently, instead use a ContentRef to it. However, you may retrieve and store a direct Resource reference temporarily, although this is only recommended at method-local scope.

member.name: T:Duality.IContentRef
member.summary: IContentRef is a general interface for content references of any type.

member.name: M:Duality.IContentRef.Is(System.Type)
member.summary: Determines if the references Resource's Type is assignable to the specified Type.
member.param: The Resource Type in question.
member.returns: True, if the referenced Resource is of the specified Type or subclassing it.

member.name: M:Duality.IContentRef.Is``1
member.summary: Determines if the references Resource's Type is assignable to the specified Type.
member.typeparam: The Resource Type in question.
member.returns: True, if the referenced Resource is of the specified Type or subclassing it.

member.name: M:Duality.IContentRef.As``1
member.summary: Creates a of the specified Type, referencing the same Resource.
member.typeparam: The Resource Type to create a reference of.
member.returns: A of the specified Type, referencing the same Resource. Returns a null reference if the Resource is not assignable to the specified Type.

member.name: M:Duality.IContentRef.MakeAvailable
member.summary: Loads the associated content as if it was accessed now. You don't usually need to call this method. It is invoked implicitly by trying to access the ContentRef.

member.name: M:Duality.IContentRef.Detach
member.summary: Discards the resolved content reference cache to allow garbage-collecting the Resource without losing its reference. Accessing it will result in reloading the Resource.

member.name: P:Duality.IContentRef.Res
member.summary: [GET] Returns the actual . If currently unavailable, it is loaded and then returned. Because of that, this Property is only null if the references Resource is missing, invalid, or this content reference has been explicitly set to null. Never returns disposed Resources.

member.name: P:Duality.IContentRef.ResWeak
member.summary: [GET] Returns the current reference to the Resource that is stored locally. No attemp is made to load or reload the Resource if currently unavailable.

member.summary: [GET] The of the referenced Resource. If currently unavailable, this is determined by the Resource file path.

member.summary: [GET / SET] The path where to look for the Resource, if it is currently unavailable.

member.summary: [GET] Returns whether this content reference has been explicitly set to null.

member.summary: [GET] Returns whether this content reference is available in general. This may trigger loading it, if currently unavailable.

member.summary: [GET] The name of the referenced Resource.

member.summary: [GET] The full name of the referenced Resource, including its path but not its file extension

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.SpriteRenderer.UVMode.Stretch
member.summary: The uv-Coordinates are constant, stretching the supplied texture to fit the SpriteRenderers dimensions.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.SpriteRenderer.UVMode.WrapHorizontal
member.summary: The u-Coordinate is calculated based on the available horizontal space, allowing the supplied texture to be tiled across the SpriteRenderers width.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.SpriteRenderer.UVMode.WrapVertical
member.summary: The v-Coordinate is calculated based on the available vertical space, allowing the supplied texture to be tiled across the SpriteRenderers height.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.SpriteRenderer.UVMode.WrapBoth
member.summary: The uv-Coordinates are calculated based on the available space, allowing the supplied texture to be tiled across the SpriteRenderers size.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Renderers.SpriteRenderer.FlipMode

member.name: M:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.UpdateVisibleFrames
member.summary: Updates the , and properties immediately. This is called implicitly once each frame before drawing, so you don't normally call this. However, when changing animation parameters and requiring updated animation frame data immediately, this could be helpful.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.AnimFirstFrame
member.summary: [GET / SET] The index of the first frame to display. Ignored if is set.
member.remarks: Animation indices are looked up in the map of the that is used.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.AnimFrameCount
member.summary: [GET / SET] The number of continous frames to use for the animation. Ignored if is set.
member.remarks: Animation indices are looked up in the map of the that is used.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.AnimDuration
member.summary: [GET / SET] The time a single animation cycle needs to complete, in seconds.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.AnimTime
member.summary: [GET / SET] The animations current play time, i.e. the current state of the animation.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.AnimPaused
member.summary: [GET / SET] If true, the animation is paused and won't advance over time. will stay constant until resumed.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.AnimLoopMode
member.summary: [GET / SET] The animations loop behaviour.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.CustomFrameSequence
member.summary: [GET / SET] A custom sequence of frame indices that will be used instead of the default range specified by and . Unused if set to null.
member.remarks: Animation indices are looked up in the map of the that is used.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.IsAnimationRunning
member.summary: [GET] Whether the animation is currently running, i.e. if there is anything animated right now.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.CurrentFrame
member.summary: [GET] The currently visible animation frames index.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.NextFrame
member.summary: [GET] The next visible animation frames index.

member.name: P:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.CurrentFrameProgress
member.summary: [GET] The current animation frames progress where zero means "just entered the current frame" and one means "about to leave the current frame". This value is also used for smooth animation blending.

member.name: T:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode
member.summary: Describes the sprite animations loop behaviour.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode.Once
member.summary: The animation is played once an then remains in its last frame.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode.Loop
member.summary: The animation is looped: When reaching the last frame, it begins again at the first one.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode.PingPong
member.summary: The animation plays forward until reaching the end, then reverses and plays backward until reaching the start again. This "pingpong" behaviour is looped.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode.RandomSingle
member.summary: A single frame is selected randomly each time the object is initialized and remains static for its whole lifetime.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode.FixedSingle
member.summary: A fixed, single frame is displayed. Which one depends on the one you set in the editor or in source code.

member.name: F:Duality.Components.Renderers.AnimSpriteRenderer.LoopMode.Queue
member.summary: The is interpreted and processed as a queue where is the time a single frame takes.

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.SpeedOfSound
member.summary: [GET / SET] The speed of sound in "meters per second". Duality units will be converted to SI units that are used in the calculation using the values provided by the static class. The speed of sound is used to calculate the doppler effect of SoundInstances that are moving relative to the .

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.SoundDopplerFactor
member.summary: [GET / SET] A factor by which the strength of the doppler effect is multiplied.

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.PhysicsVelocityThreshold
member.summary: [GET / SET] Any velocity below this value will be resolved using inelastic equations i.e. won't lead to "bouncing".

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.PhysicsFixedTime
member.summary: [GET / SET] Does the physics simulation use fixed time steps? However, this setting may be overwritten dynamically due to frame timing restrictions. To check whether fixed-timestep physics is currently active, use

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.LocalUserData
member.summary: [GET / SET] If true, user data is saved locally in the game folder instead of the current user account.

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.MultisampleBackBuffer
member.summary: [GET / SET] Determines whether or not the backbuffer uses multisampling based on . Set this to false if you don't render to the backbuffer directly, but use a custom setup. You'll have to apply possible existing user quality settings yourself.

member.name: P:Duality.DualityAppData.SkipBackends
member.summary: [GET / SET] An optional list of backend values to skip when loading.

member.name: T:Duality.RawList`1
member.summary: Encapsulates an Array and provides methods for dynamically modifying it similar to a List{T}, but allows accessing its raw internal data at the same time. This can be useful for situations wherer raw data access may significantly improve performance, but dynamic sizes are still required.
member.remarks: Use this class with caution and consideration. In almost all cases, either a List{T} or a regular Array should be preferred. You should only use this class when you know how to use it.

summary.para: The ContentProvider is Duality's main instance for content management. If you need any kind of , simply request it from the ContentProvider. It keeps track of which Resources are loaded and valid and prevents Resources from being loaded more than once at a time, thus reducing loading times and redundancy.
You can also manually register Resources that have been created at runtime using a string alias of your choice.

member.param: The root object where the search begins.
An object field visitor. Returns a new value for the visited object.

member.name: T:Duality.DualityApp
member.summary: This class controls Duality's main program flow control and general maintenance functionality. It initializes the engine, loads plugins, provides access to user input, houses global data structures and handles logfiles internally.

member.summary: Initializes this DualityApp. Should be called before performing any operations within Duality.
member.param: The in which Duality runs.
Command line arguments to run this DualityApp with. Usually these are just the ones from the host application, passed on.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.OpenWindow(Duality.Backend.WindowOptions)

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.InitPostWindow
member.summary: Initializes the part of Duality that requires a valid rendering context. Should be called before performing any rendering related operations with Duality. Is called implicitly when using .

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.Terminate
member.summary: Terminates this DualityApp. This does not end the current Process, but will instruct the engine to leave main loop and message processing as soon as possible.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.LoadPlugin(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String)
member.summary: Adds an already loaded plugin Assembly to the internal Duality CorePlugin registry. You shouldn't need to call this method in general, since Duality manages its plugins automatically.
member.remarks: This method can be useful in certain cases when it is necessary to treat an Assembly as a Duality plugin, even though it isn't located in the Plugins folder, or is not available as a file at all. A typical case for this is Unit Testing where the testing Assembly may specify additional Duality types such as Components, Resources, etc.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.ReloadPlugin(System.String)
member.summary: Reloads the specified plugin. Does not initialize it.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.GetDualityAssemblies
member.summary: Enumerates all currently loaded assemblies that are part of Duality, i.e. Duality itsself and all loaded plugins.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.GetAvailDualityTypes(System.Type)
member.summary: Enumerates all available Duality Types that are assignable to the specified Type.
member.param: The base type to use for matching the result types.
member.returns: An enumeration of all Duality types deriving from the specified type.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.Dbg(System.Action)
member.summary: This method performs an action only when compiling your plugin in debug mode. In release mode, any calls to this method (and thus the specified action) are omitted by the compiler. It is essentially syntactical sugar for one-line #if DEBUG blocks. This method is intended to be used conveniently in conjunction with lambda expressions.

member.name: M:Duality.DualityApp.EditorGuard(System.Action)
member.summary: When executed from within the editor environment, this method wraps the specified action in a safe try-catch block in order to be able to recover gracefully. In regular game execution, it will simply invoke the action without safety measures.

member.name: T:Duality.GameObject
member.summary: GameObjects are what every consists of. They represent nodes in the hierarchial scene graph and can maintain a connection. A GameObject's main duty is to group several s to form one logical instance of an actual object as part of the game, such as "Car" or "PlayerCharacter". However, the GameObjects itsself does not contain any game-related logic and, by default, doesn't even occupy a position in space. This is the job of its Components.

member.summary: Breaks this GameObject's

member.name: M:Duality.GameObject.ChildAtIndexPath(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Executes a series of calls, beginning at this GameObject and each on the last retrieved child object.
member.param: An enumeration of child indices.
member.returns: The last retrieved GameObject after executing all indexing steps.
member.example: Calling ChildAtIndexPath(new[] { 0, 0 }) will return the first child of the first child.

An optional predicate that needs to return true in order to perform the operation.

member.summary: Checks all internal data for consistency and fixes problems where possible. This helps mitigate serialization problems that arise from changing data structures during dev time.

member.summary: Checks the objects internal containers for the correct execution order and sorts them where necessary.

member.name: P:Duality.GameObject.Parent
member.summary: [GET / SET] This GameObject's parent object in the scene graph. A GameObject usually depends on its parent in some way, such as being positioned relative to it when occupying a position in space.

member.name: P:Duality.GameObject.ParentScene
member.summary: [GET] The GameObjects parent . Each GameObject can belong to exactly one Scene, or no Scene at all. To add or remove GameObjects to / from a Scene, use the and methods.

member.name: P:Duality.GameObject.Active
member.summary: [GET / SET] Whether or not the GameObject is currently active. To return true, both the GameObject itsself and all of its parent GameObjects need to be active.

member.name: P:Duality.GameObject.ActiveSingle
member.summary: [GET / SET] Whether or not the GameObject is currently active. Unlike , this property ignores parent activation states and depends only on this single GameObject. The scene graph and other Duality instances usually check , not ActiveSingle.

member.summary: [GET] The path-like hierarchial name of this GameObject.

member.summary: Saves the Resource to the specified path.
member.param: The path to which this Resource is saved to. If null, the Resources is used as destination.

When true, the Resource will be made permanently available from now on. If it has been generated at runtime or was loaded explicitly outside the ContentProvider, this will set the Resources Property and register it in the ContentProvider. If the Resource already is a permanent, this parameter will be ignored.

member.summary: DrawTechniques represent the method by which a set of colors, Textures and vertex data is applied to screen.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new, default DrawTechnique

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.#ctor(Duality.Drawing.BlendMode)
member.summary: Creates a new DrawTechnique that uses the specified .

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.#ctor(Duality.Drawing.BlendMode,Duality.ContentRef{Duality.Resources.ShaderProgram},Duality.Drawing.VertexDeclaration)
member.summary: Creates a new DrawTechnique using the specified and .

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.PrepareRendering(Duality.Drawing.IDrawDevice,Duality.Drawing.BatchInfo)
member.summary: Prepares rendering using this DrawTechnique.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Solid
member.summary: Renders solid geometry without utilizing the alpha channel. This is the fastest default DrawTechnique.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Mask
member.summary: Renders alpha-masked solid geometry. This is the recommended DrawTechnique for regular sprite rendering. If multisampling is available, it is utilized to smooth masked edges.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SharpAlpha
member.summary: Renders geometry using the alpha channel, but enforces sharp edges by using an adaptive antialiazing shader. This is the recommended DrawTechnique for rendering text or stencil sprites.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Add
member.summary: Renders additive geometry. Ideal for glow effects.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Alpha
member.summary: Renders geometry and using the alpha channel. However, for stencil-sharp alpha edges, might be sufficient and is a lot faster. Consider using it.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Multiply
member.summary: Renders geometry multiplying the existing background with incoming color values. Can be used for shadowing effects.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Light
member.summary: Renders geometry adding incoming color values weighted based on the existing background. Can be used for lighting effects.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Invert
member.summary: Renders geometry inverting the background color.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Picking
member.summary: Renders geometry for a picking operation. This isn't used for regular rendering.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Solid
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim solid geometry without utilizing the alpha channel. This is the fastest default DrawTechnique.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Mask
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim alpha-masked solid geometry. This is the recommended DrawTechnique for regular sprite rendering. If multisampling is available, it is utilized to smooth masked edges.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Add
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim additive geometry. Ideal for glow effects.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Alpha
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim geometry and using the alpha channel. However, for stencil-sharp alpha edges, might be sufficient and is a lot faster. Consider using it.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Multiply
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim geometry multiplying the existing background with incoming color values. Can be used for shadowing effects.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Light
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim geometry adding incoming color values weighted based on the existing background. Can be used for lighting effects.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.SmoothAnim_Invert
member.summary: Renders SmoothAnim geometry inverting the background color.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Blending
member.summary: [GET / SET] Specifies how incoming color values interact with the existing background color.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.Shader
member.summary: [GET / SET] The that is used for rendering.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.PreferredVertexFormat
member.summary: [GET / SET] The vertex format that is preferred by this DrawTechnique. If there is no specific preference, null is returned.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.NeedsZSort
member.summary: [GET] Returns whether this DrawTechnique requires z sorting. It is derived from its .

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.DrawTechnique.NeedsPreparation
member.summary: [GET] Returns whether this DrawTechnique requires any rendering preparation. This is false for all standard DrawTechniques, but may return true when deriving custom DrawTechniques.

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.FragmentShader
member.summary: Represents an OpenGL FragmentShader.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.FragmentShader.Minimal
member.summary: [GET] A minimal FragmentShader. It performs a texture lookup and applies vertex-coloring.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.FragmentShader.Picking
member.summary: [GET] A FragmentShader designed for picking operations. It uses the provided texture for alpha output and forwards the incoming RGB color value.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.FragmentShader.SmoothAnim
member.summary: [GET] The SmoothAnim FragmentShader. It performs two lookups on the same texture and blends the results using an incoming float value.

member.name: P:Duality.Resources.FragmentShader.SharpAlpha
member.summary: [GET] The SharpMask FragmentShader. It enforces an antialiazed sharp mask when upscaling linearly blended textures.

member.name: F:Duality.Resources.Font.RenderMode.SharpBitmap

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.Material
member.summary: Materials are standardized BatchInfos, stored as a Resource. Just like BatchInfo objects, they describe how an object, represented by a set of vertices, looks like. Using Materials is generally more performant than using BatchInfos but not always reasonable, for example when there is a single, unique GameObject with a special appearance: This is a typical case.

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.RenderTarget
member.summary: Instead of rendering to screen, RenderTargets can serve as an alternative drawing surface for a . The image is applied to one or several Textures. By default, only the first attached Texture is actually used, but you can use a custom to use all available Textures for storing information.

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.Sound
member.summary: A Sound is parameterized . Note that a Sound Resource does not contain any kind of audio data by itsself.
member.example: While there may be one AudioData Resource sounding like an Explosion effect, there could be many Sounds referring to it, like a very loud or very quiet Explosion or one that is noticable on higher distance than others.

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.Prefab
member.summary: Prefab is short for "prefabricated object" and encapsulates a single that can serve as a template. When creating a GameObject out of a Prefab, it maintains a connection to it using a object. This ensures that changes made to the Prefab propagate to all of its instances as well. It also keeps track of Properties that have been deliberately modified in the editor and restores them after re-applying the original Prefabs data.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.Prefab.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new, empty Prefab.

member.summary: Creates a new Prefab out of a GameObject.

member.summary: Discards previous data and injects the specified into the Prefab. The GameObject itsself will not be affected, instead a of it will be used for the Prefab.
member.param: The object to inject as Prefab root object.

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.PrefabLink
member.summary: Represents a GameObjects connection to the it has been instanciated from.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.PrefabLink.#ctor(Duality.GameObject,Duality.ContentRef{Duality.Resources.Prefab})
member.summary: Creates a new PrefabLink, connecting a GameObject to a Prefab.
member.param: The GameObject to link.
The Prefab to connect the GameObject with.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.PrefabLink.RelocateChanges(Duality.Resources.PrefabLink)
member.summary: Relocates the internal change list from this PrefabLink to a different, hierarchially lower PrefabLink.
member.param: The PrefabLink to which to relocate changes. It needs to be hierarchially lower than this one for the relocation to succeed.

remarks.para: In general, each PrefabLink is responsible for all hierarchially lower GameObjects. If one of them has a PrefabLink on its own, then the higher PrefabLinks responsibility ends there.

Change relocation is done when linking an existing GameObject to a Prefab although it is already affected by a hierarchially higher PrefabLink. In order to prevent both PrefabLinks to interfere with each other, all higher PrefabLink change list entries referring to that GameObject are relocated to the new, lower PrefabLink that is specifically targetting it.
This way, the above responsibility guideline remains applicable.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.PrefabLink.Clone(Duality.GameObject,Duality.ContentRef{Duality.Resources.Prefab})
member.summary: Clones the PrefabLink, but targets a different GameObject and Prefab.
member.param: The GameObject which the clone is connected to.
The Prefab which the clone will connect its GameObject to.
member.returns: A cloned version of this PrefabLink

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.PrefabLink.Clone(Duality.GameObject)
member.summary: Clones the PrefabLink, but targets a different GameObject.

member.returns: A cloned version of this PrefabLink

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.PrefabLink.ApplyChanges
member.summary: Applies this PrefabLinks change list to its GameObject. This will restore all deliberate modifications (made in the editor) of the GameObjects Properties after linking it to the Prefab.

member.name: T:Duality.Resources.Scene
member.summary: A Scene encapsulates an organized set of GameObjects and provides update-, rendering- and maintenance functionality. In Duality, there is always exactly one Scene which represents a level, gamestate or a combination of both, depending on you own design.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.Scene.SwitchTo(Duality.ContentRef{Duality.Resources.Scene},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Switches to the specified , which will become the new current one. By default, this method does not guarantee to perform the Scene switch immediately, but may defer the switch to the end of the current update cycle.
member.param: The Scene to switch to.
If true, an immediate switch is forced. Use only when necessary.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.Scene.Reload
member.summary: Reloads the current Scene or schedules it for reload at the end of the frame, depending on whether it is considered safe to do so immediately. Similar to with regard to execution planning.

member.name: M:Duality.Resources.Scene.PerformScheduledSwitch
member.summary: Performs a switch operation that was scheduled using .

member.name: T:Duality.Serialization.ObjectIdManager.ReferenceEqualityComparer
member.summary: Compares two objects for equality strictly by reference. This is needed to build the object id mapping, since some objects may expose some unfortunate equality behavior, and we really want to distinguish different objects by reference, and not by "content" here.

member.name: T:Duality.Time
member.summary: The Time class provides a global interface for time measurement and control. It affects all time-dependent computations. Use the Property to make your own computations time-dependent instead of frame-dependent. Otherwise, your game logic will depend on how many FPS the player's machine achieves and mit behave differently on very slow or fast machines.

member.name: F:Duality.Time.FPSMult
member.summary: The amount of frame per second at the desired refresh rate of 60 FPS.

member.name: F:Duality.Time.MsPFMult
member.summary: Milliseconds a frame takes at the desired refresh rate of 60 FPS

member.name: F:Duality.Time.SPFMult
member.summary: Seconds a frame takes at the desired refresh rate of 60 FPS

member.name: M:Duality.Time.Freeze
member.summary: Freezes game time. This will cause the GameTimer to stop and TimeMult to equal zero.

member.name: M:Duality.Time.Resume
member.summary: Unfreezes game time. TimeMult resumes to its normal value and GameTimer starts running again.

member.name: P:Duality.Time.StartupTime
member.summary: [GET] Returns the date and time of engine startup.

member.name: P:Duality.Time.MainTimer
member.summary: [GET] Returns the real time that has passed since engine startup.

member.name: P:Duality.Time.LastDelta
member.summary: [GET] Time in milliseconds the last frame took. Do not use this for frame-independent calculations. Use instead.

member.name: P:Duality.Time.Fps
member.summary: [GET] Frames per Second

member.name: P:Duality.Time.GameTimer
member.summary: [GET] Returns the game time that has passed since engine startup. Since it's game time, this timer will stop when pausing or freezing and also run slower or faster according to .

member.name: P:Duality.Time.TimeMult
member.summary: [GET] Multiply any frame-independend movement or change with this factor. It also applies the time scale you set.

member.name: P:Duality.Time.TimeScale
